title: [$500] Web - Chat - The "Add reaction" popup position is indicating that the message above it is selected

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

comments.body: Triggered auto assignment to @NicMendonca (`Bug`), see https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/14418 for more details.

### Bug0 Triage Checklist ([Main S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418))

- [ ] This "bug" occurs on a supported platform (ensure `Platforms` in OP are ✅)
- [ ] This bug is not a duplicate report (check [E/App issues](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues) and [#expensify-bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM))
    - If it is, comment with a link to the original report, close the issue and add any novel details to the original issue instead
- [ ] This bug is reproducible using the reproduction steps in the OP. [S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418#:~:text=The%20bug%20is%20reproducible)
    - If the reproduction steps are clear and you're unable to reproduce the bug, check with the reporter and QA first, then close the issue.
    - If the reproduction steps aren't clear and you determine the correct steps, please update the OP.
- [ ] This issue is filled out as thoroughly and clearly as possible
    - Pay special attention to the title, results, platforms where the bug occurs, and if the bug happens on staging/production.
- [ ] I have reviewed and subscribed to the linked Slack conversation to ensure Slack/Github stay in sync
Triggered auto assignment to Contributor-plus team member for initial proposal review - @sobitneupane (`External`)

## Proposal ### Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue. When selecting a reaction from the emoji picker, it isn't clear which message the reaction will apply to. ### What is the root cause of that problem? I don't believe the positioning of the picker should be relied on as an indicator of which message is being reacted to - the message should be highlighted instead. This is what we currently do with the context menu as well, so it’s obvious what message it’s in reference to. Popover positioning is complicated to do well, and in some cases, such as screen size limitations, you simply can't use positioning to indicate what the popover references - that's why many popovers have arrow indicators, because for positioning, visibility and interactivity of the popover content is more important than positioning it desirably. And even if we could, it still would not be absolutely clear which message was being reacted to, the popover is too large for that. The root cause is that we don't highlight the relevant message when the emoji picker is open. This doesn't seem to be a regression, we just don't do it. We do it for the context menu, but not the emoji picker (note `isContextMenuActive`): https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/eef8347c59b5a3bb7fc508484f4c32ff092a05da/src/pages/home/report/ReportActionItem.js#L671 _Message highlighted when context menu is open_ _Message not highlighted when emoji picker is open_ ### What changes do you think we should make in order to solve the problem? We should highlight the relevant message when the emoji picker is open, just like we do when the context menu is active.

## Proposal

### Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue.

The `EmojiPicker` by `Add reaction` button in context menu is positioned as if the message above the selected one is selected

### What is the root cause of that problem?

The anchor position of the `EmojiPicker` is calculated by anchor and origin here
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/72e73ae6d922b915198e0a5bcff9d71de5a1001b/src/components/EmojiPicker/EmojiPicker.js#L59

In the above code, anchor is the `Add reaction` button and the origin is `DEFAULT_ANCHOR_ORIGIN` defined here
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/72e73ae6d922b915198e0a5bcff9d71de5a1001b/src/components/EmojiPicker/EmojiPicker.js#L14-L17

That is, the anchor position is based on the `Add reaction` button, not on the selected message. 

This is the root cause

### What changes do you think we should make in order to solve the problem?

The position of the `Add reaction` button is changed by the message type and so the position of the `EmojiPicker` will also be changed. I think the ideal solution would be to set the anchor position based on the selected message. It'd be better if we can set the anchor position of the `EmojiPicker` same as the anchor position of context menu

We calculated the anchor position of the context menu here
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/72e73ae6d922b915198e0a5bcff9d71de5a1001b/src/pages/home/report/ContextMenu/PopoverReportActionContextMenu.js#L169-L172

Pass this value to the `EmojiPicker` to use instead of anchor and origin

This works as expected

The complete solution can be found here https://github.com/s-alves10/App/tree/fix/issue-31577

<details>
    <summary>Result</summary>


https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/126839717/1029fc23-a33a-497f-ae0c-0749c40b3617


</details>

### What alternative solutions did you explore? (Optional)

### Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue.
The "Add reaction" popup position is indicating that the message above it is selected

### What is the root cause of that problem?
Function named `calculateAnchorPosition` that yields both the horizontal and vertical values, where the vertical value is responsible for the misalignment of the popup.

### What changes do you think we should make in order to solve the problem?
File path:- https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/6c29cabf1cce381bc927af52f819223ba6b541bc/src/libs/calculateAnchorPosition.ts#L29

The adjustment in the vertical position by adding 50 units ensures proper placement above the anchor element.

 `return resolve({horizontal: x + width, vertical: y + 50});`

### Video:- 
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1esXNtk-pIefZEVWb4Lx2epmj76rp6R7t/view?usp=sharing
@NicMendonca, @sobitneupane Uh oh! This issue is overdue by 2 days. Don't forget to update your issues!

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 1.4.1.4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team **Slack conversation:** ## Action Performed: 1. Navigate to https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Open any 1:1 chat with a few messages 3. Right click on a message 4. Click on the "Add reaction" button ## Expected Result: The popup should be near the original text ## Actual Result: The "Add reaction" popup position is indicating that the message above it is selected ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Which of our officially supported platforms is this issue occurring on? - [ ] Android: Native - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: Native - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos Add any screenshot/video evidence https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/78819774/5d18a2fb-b7d5-48e2-9ced-54c62750a386 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
